ddb-importer.image-upload-directory.name: Image upload directory
ddb-importer.image-upload-directory.hint: Specificies the image upload location on the server.
ddb-importer.scene-upload-directory.name: Scene upload directory
ddb-importer.scene-upload-directory.hint: Specificies the scene upload location on the server.
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.name: Compendium import policy (GM only)
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.hint: Defines if imported items should be saved into the compendiums below, and under which circumstances.
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.0: Save all entities, overwrite existing ones
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.1: Save new entities only, do not overwrite existing ones
ddb-importer.entity-import-policy.2: Do not save the entities at all
ddb-importer.entity-cleanup-policy.name: Cleaning policy
ddb-importer.entity-cleanup-policy.hint: When saving imports to compendiums, you can decide if you want to clean up the entities from the current world or keep them
ddb-importer.entity-cleanup-policy.0: Keep all entities in the world
ddb-importer.entity-item-compendium.name: Item compendium
ddb-importer.entity-feature-compendium.h: Class features compendium for imported features
ddb-importer.entity-race-compendium.name: Race compendium
ddb-importer.entity-trait-compendium.hin: Racial trait compendium for imported racial traits
ddb-importer.entity-feat-compendium.name: Feat compendium
ddb-importer.entity-item-spell-compendiu: Target compendium for imported spells belonging to magic items
ddb-importer.entity-monster-feature-comp: Target compendium for imported monster features
ddb-importer.log-level.name: Log Level
ddb-importer.log-level.hint: The level of console log statements that should be displayed in the console.
ddb-importer.allow-scene-download.name: Allow Download of Scene Data
ddb-importer.allow-scene-download.hint: If you wish to submit data for walls and lighting of a scene use this option to download a config file for submission.
ddb-importer.scene-format.name: Scene image format
ddb-importer.scene-format.hint: Sets the scene image format. WEBP is recommended due to smaller file size and faster loading speeds.
ddb-importer.custom-proxy.name: Use a custom proxy?
ddb-importer.custom-proxy.hint: Tick if using a custom proxy and enter the proxy URL's below
ddb-importer.cobalt-cookie.name: DDB Cobalt Cookie
ddb-importer.cobalt-cookie.hint: You can get this using my Chrome extension https://github.com/MrPrimate/ddb-importer-chrome
ddb-importer.campaign-id.name: DDB Campaign URL or ID
ddb-importer.campaign-id.hint: Enter the campaign URL or ID, e.g. https://www.dndbeyond.com/campaigns/12345 or 12345
ddb-importer.beta-key.name: Patreon supporter Beta Key
ddb-importer.beta-key.hint: Some Patreon supporter tiers have access to Beta features, enter your key here
ddb-importer.auto-create-compendium.name: Auto create compendiums if not present?
ddb-importer.auto-create-compendium.hint: Auto create compendiums if not present?
ddb-importer.use-full-source.name: Use full source book name?
ddb-importer.monster-has-vision.name: Should imported monster have vision set?
ddb-importer.monster-has-vision.hint: If unticked monsters will not have vision set
ddb-importer.restrict-to-trusted.name: Restrict to Trusted Users
ddb-importer.restrict-to-trusted.hint: Restrict character import to Trusted Users
ddb-importer.allow-all-sync.name: Allow all users to sync to DDB
ddb-importer.allow-all-sync.hint: If character import is restricted, this option will still allow players to sync back to DDB.
ddb-importer.setup.name: Core setup
ddb-importer.compendium-setup.name: Compendiums
ddb-importer.monster-link-title.name: Monster D&D Beyond link in title bar?
ddb-importer.monster-link-title.hint: Otherwise it's a button next to the name. (Reload to take effect).
ddb-importer.character-link-title.name: Character DDB-Importer button in title bar?
ddb-importer.character-link-title.hint: Otherwise it's a button next to the name. (Reload to take effect).
ddb-importer.link-title-colour-white.hin: Default is Red. Reload to take effect.
ddb-importer.use-damage-hints.name: Use damage type hints?
ddb-importer.use-damage-hints.hint: When building damage strings e.g. 1d6[healing]. Useful for MidiQOL etc.
